meanings.definition: The action of animals coming together to breed.
meanings.sent1: The zookeepers observed the lions' mating in the wild.
meanings.sent2: The mating season for birds is in the spring.
meanings.sent3: The mating dance of the peacock was quite a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The mating of colors in the painting created a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent5: The researchers studied the intricate process of mating in insects.

meanings.definition: The act of joining together in a sexual relationship.
meanings.sent1: The documentary explored the complex rituals of animal mating.
meanings.sent2: Their mating was a private affair between the two individuals.
meanings.sent3: The mating of flavors in the dish was surprisingly delicious.
meanings.sent4: The mating of voices in the choir performance was truly mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The novel depicted the forbidden mating of two characters from different worlds.

meanings.definition: The process of connecting or fitting together.
meanings.sent1: The mating of the puzzle pieces was challenging but satisfying.
meanings.sent2: The mating of the gears ensured the smooth operation of the machine.
meanings.sent3: The mating of ideas from different fields led to a groundbreaking discovery.
meanings.sent4: The mating of technology and art created innovative designs.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter focused on the precise mating of the wooden joints for a sturdy structure.
